trans-unit.source: Quick index for architecture, SSR/hydration, labs, and ADRs.
Architecture, rendering, performance, and labs index.
Snapshot of key trade-offs and outcomes.
Choose a doc to load its content here.
Select a document to preview its contents here.
Clear technical baseline, performance first, real learning
This app separates real routes and labs to explain modern features with measurable and traceable examples.
SSG on home, SSR on Pokedex, CSR on labs.
Typed client, cache, dedupe, and limited concurrency.
Tailwind, CDK, and Angular Aria with end-to-end keyboard support.
Labels, helper text, and live updates without stealing focus.
All fields are required. Results update in the status region below.
Use arrow keys or tab to move through options.
Enter/leave motion with a staggered list.
Add a toast to see the entry animation.
Overlay plan, focus trapping, portals, and focus restore.
Overlay plan covers focus, portals, and accessibility.
Backdrop + escape to close; positioned pane.
Return focus to trigger on close.
Goals, steps, cache, SSR checks, and rollback.
Pipeline is planned with cache, SSR checks, and rollback.
Lint → test → build with tools noted.
Inject a shared service and see how provider scope changes state.
Add a note to see it shared within this component scope.
Model-driven fields with schema validation and field state feedback.
Fix the highlighted fields to continue.
Complete the fields to enable Save.
Fetch a Pokemon by name and watch the resource state update.
Search for a Pokemon to begin.
Unable to load the Pokemon. Try another name.
Budgets, defer plan, assets, and network discipline.
Guardrails set: budgets, defer, assets, and network controls.
Keep installability clear and avoid caching API data.
Ready: app shell caches static assets and avoids API caching.
Static assets cached, routes fall back to index.
External data not added to SW config.
Use the router to swap panels without leaving the lab.
The router reads the `view` query param and keeps the panel in sync with the URL.
A real guard would block navigation. Here we just show how a guard can change the allowed view.
A resolver would prefetch data for the detail panel before rendering it.
Simulate blocking access with a guard.
Bridge input streams into signals and expose outputs as Observables.
No output yet. Click Apply to emit an event.
Select up to three Pokemon to compare.
Check selectors, class names, and file bases.
Fix naming to match the project conventions.
All naming rules pass for this feature.
Toggle common utilities and see the applied class string.
Spacing, radius, shadow, accent, and outline are all toggleable.
Mock HTTP, drive routing, and guard client-only APIs.
Tests are SSR-safe with mocked HTTP and guarded client APIs.
Optional axe-core or similar check for markup.
Isolated labs per feature to learn and measure.
Base v1: name, id, images, types, and stats.
Base v1: list, pagination, sorting, and simple filters.
